refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.simpara: The unicharambigs file (a component of traineddata, see combine_tessdata(1) ) is used by Tesseract to represent possible ambiguities between characters, or groups of characters.
The file contains a number of lines, laid out as follow:

entry.simpara: the number of characters contained in field two
the character sequence to be replaced
the number of characters contained in field four
the character sequence used to replace field two
contains either 1 or 0. 1 denotes a mandatory replacement, 0 denotes an optional replacement.

refsect1.simpara: Characters appearing in fields two and four should appear in unicharset. The numbers in fields one and three refer to the number of unichars (not bytes).

refsect1.title: EXAMPLE
refsect1.simpara: In this example, all instances of the 2 character sequence '' will always be replaced by the 1 character sequence "; a 1 character sequence m may be replaced by the 2 character sequence rn, and the 3 character sequence may be replaced by the 1 character sequence m.

refsect1.title: HISTORY
refsect1.simpara: The unicharambigs file first appeared in Tesseract 3.00; prior to that, a similar format, called DangAmbigs (dangerous ambiguities) was used: the format was almost identical, except only mandatory replacements could be specified, and field 5 was absent.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.simpara: This is a documentation "bug": it’s not currently clear what should be done in the case of ligatures (such as fi) which may also appear as regular letters in the unicharset.
